intro: Tessaranthium, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive star-shaped blooms. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, brightly colored flowers. Tessaranthium thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements make it a valued addition to many gardens.
